meanings.definition: A material thing that can be seen and touched.
meanings.sent1: The shiny objects on the table caught my eye.
meanings.sent2: She collected various objects during her travels.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat batted the objects off the shelf.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as the objects in the display window.
meanings.sent5: The objects in the museum were carefully preserved for generations to admire.

meanings.definition: A person or thing to which a specified action or feeling is directed.
meanings.sent1: He considered her the object of his affection.
meanings.sent2: The teacher made the student the object of praise.
meanings.sent3: The object of their game was to reach the finish line first.
meanings.sent4: She became the object of envy among her peers.
meanings.sent5: The object of his desire was always just out of reach.

meanings.sent1: Her main object was to finish the race.
meanings.sent2: The object of the meeting was to discuss the new project.
meanings.sent3: His object in life was to make a positive impact on others.
meanings.sent4: The object of the mission was to bring back valuable data.
meanings.sent5: Their object was to create a peaceful and harmonious community.
